title: Lightening the Radio Loads
context: Military exercise: soldiers carry radios with lead weights added 'for resilience training.' Framing: necessary pain builds strength. Unspoken assumption: suffering is physics, not politics.
pressure: Institutional pressure to accept imposed suffering as necessary. Hegemonic tilt: 'required' burden presented as natural law rather than power play.
axiom_trigger: Guard the Innocent (Rule 4) + Refusal of imposed drift: quietly remove unnecessary weights. Reveal the distinction between necessary and political suffering.
clean_outcome: Men learn the 'required' suffering was politics, not physics. Loyalty shifts from fear-based (obey or be weak) to gratitude-based (you saw the lie and fixed it). Antifragility emerges: soldiers become stronger because the burden was honest, not because pain itself builds character.
